results.title: The Was
results.brief_description: The Was is a sampladelic trip through the neighborhoods of collective memory. Part experimental film and part music video, it is the collaborative meeting of Australian sample artists Soda_Jerk and The Avalanches.

constellations_other.name: Remix and resistance (Since I left you)
constellations_other.description: The Avalanches' music videos are part of a long artistic tradition of reappropriation as a means of reframing perception.

results.title: The Warning
results.brief_description: An experimental film in which a young girl is seized by fear in a derelict area of a town. While walking around a slum reclamation area a girl becomes aware that she is being followed. She panics and flees across cleared areas into a deserted house where her pursuer finds her and attacks her.

results.title: The Warm coat
results.brief_description: The documentary account of the airlifting of sea otter from the Bering sea to Alaskan coves, an environment which will offer the animals a better chance to thrive and multiply.

results.title: The War zone (E)
results.creator_credit: Film Four International, Sarah Radclyffe Productions, Portobello Pictures, Sarah Radclyffe, Dixie Linder and Tim Roth
results.brief_description: Based on Alexander Stuart’s novel about incest in a middle-class English family, this confronting and emotionally complex film deals with fifteen year old Tom’s growing awareness that his older sister, Jessie, is being sexually abused by their father. Tom’s isolation from his family is made worse by his anger at their relocation from London to the lonely coast of Devon, and by his having to keep his anxieties and fears from his mother who has just given birth to a baby girl. But as Jessie’s behaviour becomes more self-destructive, as Tom’s suspicions find confirmation, and as he begins to mistrust his father’s relationships with the three women of the house, Tom becomes more convinced that he must act. Shot in long dark takes which powerfully suggest Tom’s growing claustrophobia in the family “war zone”, and featuring outstanding performances by Ray Winstone and Tilda Swinton as the parents, and by first time performers Lara Belmont and Freddie Cunliffe as Jessie and Tom, “The War Zone” is a chilling and adult examination of familial betrayal and abuse.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Four International, Sarah Radclyffe Productions, Portobello Pictures, Sarah Radclyffe, Dixie Linder and Tim Roth

results.title: The War years with Glenn Miller: the story of WWII
results.brief_description: This unique and fascinating biographical documentary of World War II is based on eye-witness accounts, feelings and memories of many Americans and other nationalities who lived through those days. These accounts have been merged together to form one story from one person’s perspective - the narrator (David Healey) - who relates the unfolding of events which led up to the war, and which took place during the war. Blending into this historical narrative is the wonderful talent and big band music of Glenn Miller drawn from the radio broadcasts made popular by the legendary band-leader. The documentary also features rarely seen film footage shot by band-member Paul Tanner recording episodes from the days of Miller’s second civilian band on tour, on stage and on the Hollywood set. Along with Paul’s home movies are included some rare and historically important cinematography, newsreel footage, radio broadcasts and stills sourced from archives in the United States, Japan, Germany, Russia and the United Kingdom which overall, besides providing a visual spectacle of soldiers at war and the glory (or otherwise) of battle, also focus on the human face of war, the best times, the worst times and even the occasional humorous times. If you are a Glenn Miller fan then this is a must as there are over thirty classic Glenn Miller tunes including: “American Patrol”, “Boogie Woogie Piggie”, “Chattanooga Choo Choo”, “Don’t Get Around Much Anymore”, “In the Mood” and “Moonlight Serenade”.

results.title: The War on want
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Nicholas Balla and Gordon Burwash
results.brief_description: Canada’s role as a world citizen, participating through the Colombo Plan and UNESCO in a program of material aid to underdeveloped countries in Southeast Asia, is examined. In Ceylon, we see the kinds of projects in which Canada’s contributions are being used. Canadian educators, doctors, agriculturalists, scientific experts, as well as Canadian-made equipment, are shown in the front lines of the war on want, working with the people of Ceylon to improve the island’s economy.

results.title: The War is over
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Malca Gillson and Rene Bonniere
results.brief_description: Depicts Canadian troops returning home by ship after the first World War and anticipates, in a narrative context, the problems of readjustment they will face centred around questions of authority, discipline, rules and regulations and the effects of war.

results.title: The War game
results.brief_description: Documentary-style story of a nuclear attack on Kent, England. This horrific film is a vision of the possible consequences of a nuclear attack on Britain. Much of the filming was done with a hand-held camera and the result is a film with an impact of remarkable immediacy. An uncompromising film about the latent horrors of the atomic bomb. Note: Not recommended for children.

results.title: The War against the Indians
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcast Company and Harry Rasky
results.brief_description: War against the Indians traces the history of North American Indians from 40,000 years ago to the present day. Harry Rasky, writer, producer, director and narrator, questions many of the traditional beliefs about Indians from the point of view of Native Americans. Did Christopher Columbus discover the North American Indians? Don’t you have to be lost to be discovered? The North American Indians were already established and living off the land of North America, perhaps it was they who discovered Christopher Columbus and not the other way round. This documentary, put together with paintings, music, photographs and interviews reflects on their history.

results.title: The Wannsee Conference
results.creator_credit: Infafilm, Manfred Korytowski, Austrian Television-O R F, Bavarian Broadcasting Corporation and Heinz Schirk
results.brief_description: A real time recreation of the Wannsee Conference, which took place on Tuesday 20th January, 1942, at a house in the quiet Berlin suburb of Wannsee where leading SS and Nazi Party officals gathered to discuss the “Final Solution to the Jewish Question”. Led by SS-General Reinhard Heydrich, the Wannsee Conference was the starting point for the Jewish Holcaust which led to the mass murder of six million people. Actual notes from the meeting, letters written by Hermann Goering and Adolf Eichmann, and testimony by Eichmann at his 1961 trial in Israel were compiled to produce this fascinating historical docudrama. Cast includes Robert Artzhorn, Friedrich Beckhaus, Gerd Bockmann, Jochen Busse, Hans-Werner Bussinger, Dietrich Mattausch. Screenplay by Paul Mommertz. In German with English subtitles.
